body:
> > > We can see the logic of oap and agent isn't consistent; the topics of oap depend on "mm2SourceAlias" and "mm2SourceSeparator" besides of namespace and origin topic; I can't find the usage of "mm2SourceAlias" and "mm2SourceSeparator";
> 
> > 
> 
> > I haven't checked the codes yet, but your description is not clear. Are these configs are used ot not? Or just use at the oap side?
> 
> 
> 
> @wu-sheng yes, the two fields just effect the creating of kafka topic in oap;  when getting kafka topic, oap using the two fields, but agent doesn't use them
> 
> 

I think this is never added at the agent side. And creating and fetching inconsistent is a bug for sure.
I think we can't know. Maybe it is better to read the codes whether it is a naming issue or bug.

Pls check very carefully the enhanced method on which this interceptor is imposed and the logic of the spring-kafka 1.x.

We also have an e2e test targeting at this plugin, as you can find here  https://github.com/apache/skywalking/tree/master/test/plugin/scenarios/spring-kafka-1.3.x-scenario

> Pls check very carefully the enhanced method on which this interceptor is imposed and the logic of the spring-kafka 1.x.
> 
> 
> 
> We also have an e2e test targeting at this plugin, as you can find here  https://github.com/apache/skywalking/tree/master/test/plugin/scenarios/spring-kafka-1.3.x-scenario
> 
> 

It is more about naming confusion. I think. I know we have plugin test.

> > Pls check very carefully the enhanced method on which this interceptor is imposed and the logic of the spring-kafka 1.x.
> > We also have an e2e test targeting at this plugin, as you can find here  https://github.com/apache/skywalking/tree/master/test/plugin/scenarios/spring-kafka-1.3.x-scenario
> 
> It is more about naming confusion. I think. I know we have plugin test.

Yes. I guess so.

Probably we can change the `beforeMethod`, `afterMethod` to `start(end)PollIteration` or something similar?
@wu-sheng  got stucked when avoiding the orginal url overwritten by fallback url , should work fine now
I have raised a discussion mail to dev@s.a.o, https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r54096403dc5c6ac9b31033293a72997bf50350ff7c15f1d0ab31e7a8%40%3Cdev.skywalking.apache.org%3E

> Probably we can change the `beforeMethod`, `afterMethod` to `start(end)PollIteration` or something similar?

It seems so.

> start demo
I got an error because of the "yanggy-skywalking-meters" topic doesn't exist

`KafkaReporterPluginConfig#Plugin#Kafka#NAMESPACE` should be able to work at the agent side for the namespace. I am not saying there is no bug, as I didn't check all details. This is for namespace topic of agent side specific.

FYI @a1vin-tian. We have done a lot of optimization in this 8.7.0 iteration, you could follow my previous PRs. All these optimizations are backed by @Ax1an 's production environment experiences and pre-prod experiments/feedback.

> In theory the grpc libs can work after forking but maybe only if the lib is initialized after the fork or maybe not

A quick search shows that it works only when forking is done before any channels are established. https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/doc/fork_support.md#111

> A quick search shows that it works only when forking is done before any channels are established. https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/doc/fork_support.md#111

I did see that file and it is not exactly as you say - 1.11 "This allows forking after creating a channel. However, the channel must not have issued any RPCs prior to the fork." - which is what I saw in testing more or less. So for example would it be possible to shut down the channel before fork and recreate in parent and child after? So far I have not been able to so requested comments here.

@wu-sheng 
added comment， it might a little bit lengthy to explain the best matching thing, so I am going to talk about it briefly here.

The short version is that without this check, the span of origin request will have url of fallback as it's name.

When there is a fallback in webflux (like a hystrix fallback or a webflux fallback method that involve visiting a new url).  This interceptor would be invoked twice, one for origin request and another for fallback request.  The ServerWebExchange for these two aren't exactly the same one, but the former one is a delegate inside of the latter one, thus, they **share the same attributes.**  

The problem of the old code is that get the span from attributes within the execution of Mono would get span for latter request twice.   so just move this part of code out could solve the problem.

Then there is a new question about the operation name. Because  _BEST_MATCHING_PATTERN_ATTRIBUTE_  is also in attributes,  leave the setOperationName in  Mono make both two spans use the fallback url as operationName. But move these codes out would change the recording result of requests with path parameters, from /annotation/{test} to /annotation/foo or /annotation/loo with the parameter shown, because the best matching pattern is calculated after mono are subscribed.  And that's what makes the plugin test fail before.

I tried several ways on  adjusting the order of execution  to solve this,  but it seems imposibble to make the mono chain work like expected. So instead I check whether the best matching pattern really match the url.  This check code is how webflux generating the best match pattern, so should not lead to any problem.

Yes, for most case, only one exit span should be generated to save the cost of memory and GC, due to new spans are meaningless. The failback actually is a part of the original exit span's behaviors.

@wu-sheng yeah, KafkaReporterPluginConfig#Plugin#Kafka#NAMESPACE does work at the agent side for the namespace. but when using namespace at the oap and agent side, oap will create four  topics except for "meter" topics.  whereas, when starting agent with the same namespace, agent will check the "meter" topic is or not existed.  That's to say, agent will check five kind of metric topics but oap only register and create four topics depending on the default config. So I suggest that we should give default "true" value to "enableMeterSystem" in application.yaml at oap side  in order to keep the logic consistency of creating and consuming topic at oap and agent side. Good catch, but we need to discuss how to fix it. If we keep updating the instance, then the instance could be inserted multiple times in the index.

First of all, we don't have WebSphere plugin, we don't know how this works. But we have read users deployed it on the WebSphere, but use the SpringMVC plugin.

I don't know what is your case. Also, WebSphere is a commercial product, in the ASF, we don't plan to hijack that. This would lead to an IP issue.

My skywalking share a same es cluster with other business。

To standardize all index settings ,like number_of_shards、number_of_replicas ,ES ops set a  common base template which using "*" as index_patters。

“*” means it can matching all index.

```
 GET _template/base
```

```
{
  "base" : {
    "order" : 0,
    "index_patterns" : [
      "*"
    ],
   "settings":{
     "number_of_shards"： "10",
     "number_of_replicas"： "3"
     ......
   }
   ......
}
```

the "number_of_replicas" is too many for skywalking data ,and the"number_of_shards" is too less。but some config may be fitness. 

so i want to raise the skywalking priority in template merging ，rather than  change common base template`s index_pattern to  exclude skywalking index.

Its also work to create a ES cluster only for skywalking, And other config is not allowed。 It is OK。
but having ability to set order is  more nice.
According to the doc you shared, the higher-order could override the lower. Then do you mean we should add a setting item, but still keep it as `0` in default?

> What do you mean own implementation? I don't think we would provide 2 kinds of implementations.
> 
> Could you provide more context?

Makes it easy for users to add their own alarm implementations, It's mean that user can use `selector` to extend sw alarm logical, like :

```yaml
alarm:
  selector: ${SW_ALARM:myAlarm}
  default:
  myAlarm:
```

For our case, we may use myAlarm to implement multi-tenant alarm logical, and we can reuse alarm-default-plugin core at the same time.
